intro: Cryptandra beverleyensis, commonly known as the Beverley's cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. It has small, narrow leaves and produces woody capsules as its fruit, which contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
